info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 30 at 4:55PM EDT until July 30 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... North central Elbert County in northeastern Georgia... Southeastern Hart County in northeastern Georgia... Southwestern Anderson County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 545 PM EDT. * At 455 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Hartwell, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Hartwell, Starr, Rock Branch, Nuberg, Iva, Sadlers Creek State Park, Homeland Park and Lake Hartwell. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
